content.description:
The problem traverses a low lip on perfect stone over a very good landing.

Sit start with a left hand on the mini-arete feature and a right hand pinch. From there, place a heel, fire a big right hand, move the left to a nipple-esque two-finger, move the heel, tic tac the hands, bring the heel along, fire another right hand to a pinch at the prow's tip, follow with the heel again, crank up with the left to an edge, match, then finish up the remaining easy slab for the topout.
content.protection: Two pads will work very well. The landing is very good, but the final move to the pinch is over an uneven landing.
content.location: It climbs the south facing nose of Hinterland.

content.description: Sit start with a big left hand sidepull and a right hand bump/edge on the arete. From there, make a big pull up to a huge, left hand block, place a right heel, reach a right hand pinch, bump the left up to a fingerlock, cross over with the right to an edge, hit the edge above with the left hand, bring the feet over onto the face, work the left hand up the big sidepull to the arete, then top it out at the boulder's apex.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is flat and clear, perfect.
content.location:
It starts out on the boulder's blunt west arete, crosses over to the north arete, and shares the finish of

Air Out The Sound

.

content.description: Sit start pulling with the left hand on the arete and a right hand mantling a sloper bump lower on the face. From there, follow the arete for its entirety, top it out at the apex.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the north arete of Hinterland.
